text: Bhesa sinica is an evergreen tree with buttressed trunk in the Centroplacaceae family. It is endemic to China, being only known from the coast of Guanxi. Only three mature trees and a few saplings are known to exist in the wild. ==References== sinica Category:Endemic flora of China Category:Trees of China Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Plants described in 1981
title: Bhesa sinica
